md:titleInfo.md:title: Florus Lugdunensis, Expositio in epp. Pauli
Florus Lugdunensis, Expositio in epp. Pauli

md:note.div:
[olim kps. 20]
Pergament, 1f., ca. 33,5 × 23,5 cm; saec. XII
Fragmentet rummer et stykke af Florus Lugdunensis kompilatoriske Expositio in Epistolas Beati Pauli ex operibus sancti Augustini collecta. Rectosiden rummer slutningen af Expositio in Epistolam I ad Corinthios , versosiden begyndelsen af Expositio in Epistolam II ad Corinthios:
Recto: "Et cum uoluntas eius conuenitur ... Anathema greco sermone dixit condempnatus Maranatha difiniuit ! donec dominus redeat" (= In Epistolam I ad Corinthios, cap. 15 & 16; cf. PL 119 351B-352C). Recto-siden begynder i et citat fra Augustinus’ De gratia et libero arbitrio
Verso: "Incipit expositio in secunda epistola ad corinthios. Paulus apostolus ihesu christi per uoluntatem Dei. Amat Paulus dici a nobis peccata sua ... quia inchoauit. Nemo est diabo///" (= In Epistolam II ad Corinthios, cap. 1; cf. PL 119 351C-352C)
Fragmentets signatur er skrevet på verso-siden
Bibl.: Katalog over Det Kongelige Biblioteks permanente Udstilling, København 1908, p. 2 no. 20 ("12-13. Aarh. ... Neumünster")
Erik Petersen

[olim kps. 20]
Parchment, 1f., ca. 33,5 × 23,5 cm; saec. XII
The leaf has been part of a manuscript containing Florus Lugdunensis' compilatatory Expositio in Epistolas Beati Pauli ex operibus sancti Augustini collecta. The recto contains the end of Expositio in Epistolam I ad Corinthios , the verso the beginning of Expositio in Epistolam II ad Corinthios:
Recto: "Et cum uoluntas eius conuenitur ... Anathema greco sermone dixit condempnatus Maranatha difiniuit ! donec dominus redeat" (= In Epistolam I ad Corinthios, cap. 15 & 16; cf. PL 119 351B-352C). Recto-siden begynder i et citat fra Augustinus’ De gratia et libero arbitrio
Verso: "Incipit expositio in secunda epistola ad corinthios. Paulus apostolus ihesu christi per uoluntatem Dei. Amat Paulus dici a nobis peccata sua ... quia inchoauit. Nemo est diabo///" (= In Epistolam II ad Corinthios, cap. 1; cf. PL 119 351C-352C)
The shelfmark has been written on the verso of the leaf
Erik Petersen
